notes.text:
An update is now available for Service Telemetry Framework 1.5.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Service Telemetry Framework (STF) provides automated collection of measurements and data from remote clients, such as Red Hat OpenStack Platform or third-party nodes. STF then transmits the information to a centralized, receiving Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) deployment for storage, retrieval, and monitoring.

Security Fix(es):

* golang: crypto/elliptic: IsOnCurve returns true for invalid field elements (CVE-2022-23806)

* golang: math/big: uncontrolled memory consumption due to an unhandled overflow via Rat.SetString (CVE-2022-23772)

* golang: cmd/go: misinterpretation of branch names can lead to incorrect access control (CVE-2022-23773)

* golang: encoding/pem: fix stack overflow in Decode (CVE-2022-24675)

* golang: crypto/elliptic: panic caused by oversized scalar (CVE-2022-28327)

* golang: syscall: faccessat checks wrong group (CVE-2022-29526)

* golang: compress/gzip: stack exhaustion in Reader.Read (CVE-2022-30631)

* golang: io/fs: stack exhaustion in Glob (CVE-2022-30630)

* golang: net/http: improper sanitization of Transfer-Encoding header (CVE-2022-1705)

* golang: path/filepath: stack exhaustion in Glob (CVE-2022-30632)

* golang: net/http: handle server errors after sending GOAWAY (CVE-2022-27664)

* golang: regexp/syntax: limit memory used by parsing regexps (CVE-2022-41715)

* golang: net/http: An attacker can cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests (CVE-2022-41717)

* golang: crypto/tls: session tickets lack random ticket_age_add (CVE-2022-30629)

* golang: math/big: decoding big.Float and big.Rat types can panic if the encoded message is too short, potentially allowing a denial of service (CVE-2022-32189)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

cwe.name: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling')

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. The HTTP/1 client accepted invalid Transfer-Encoding headers indicating "chunked" encoding. This issue could allow request smuggling, but only if combined with an intermediate server that also improperly accepts the header as invalid.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: improper sanitization of Transfer-Encoding header
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#2107374: improper sanitization of Transfer-Encoding header

remediations.details:
The Service Telemetry Framework container image provided by this update can be downloaded from the Red Hat Container Registry at registry.access.redhat.com. Installation instructions for your platform are available at Red Hat Container Catalog (see References).

Dockerfiles and scripts should be amended either to refer to this new image specifically, or to the latest image generally.

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the big package of the math library in golang. The Rat.SetString could cause an overflow, and if left unhandled, it could lead to excessive memory use. This issue could allow a remote attacker to impact the availability of the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: math/big: uncontrolled memory consumption due to an unhandled overflow via Rat.SetString
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#2053532: CVE-2022-23772 golang: math/big: uncontrolled memory consumption due to an unhandled overflow via Rat.SetString

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2022-23772 golang: math/big: uncontrolled memory consumption due to an unhandled overflow via Rat.SetString

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the go package of the cmd library in golang. The go command could be tricked into accepting a branch, which resembles a version tag. This issue could allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to bypass security restrictions and introduce invalid or incorrect tags, reducing the integrity of the environment.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: cmd/go: misinterpretation of branch names can lead to incorrect access control
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#2053541: CVE-2022-23773 golang: cmd/go: misinterpretation of branch names can lead to incorrect access control

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the elliptic package of the crypto library in golang when the IsOnCurve function could return true for invalid field elements. This flaw allows an attacker to take advantage of this undefined behavior, affecting the availability and integrity of the resource.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: crypto/elliptic: IsOnCurve returns true for invalid field elements
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#2053429: CVE-2022-23806 golang: crypto/elliptic: IsOnCurve returns true for invalid field elements

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A buffer overflow flaw was found in Golang's library encoding/pem. This flaw allows an attacker to use a large PEM input (more than 5 MB), causing a stack overflow in Decode, which leads to a loss of availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: fix stack overflow in Decode
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#2077688: fix stack overflow in Decode

notes.text: A flaw was found in the golang package. In net/http in Go, attackers can cause a denial of service because an HTTP/2 connection can hang during closing if a fatal error preempts the shutdown.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: handle server errors after sending GOAWAY
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: An integer overflow flaw was found in Golang's crypto/elliptic library. This flaw allows an attacker to use a crafted scaler input longer than 32 bytes, causing P256().ScalarMult or P256().ScalarBaseMult to panic, leading to a loss of availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: panic caused by oversized scalar
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#2077689: panic caused by oversized scalar

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Insufficient Permissions or Privileges

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the syscall.Faccessat function when calling a process by checking the group. This flaw allows an attacker to check the process group permissions rather than a member of the file's group, affecting system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: faccessat checks wrong group
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: A flaw was found in the crypto/tls golang package. When session tickets are generated by crypto/tls, it is missing the ticket expiration. This issue may allow an attacker to observe the TLS handshakes to correlate successive connections during session resumption.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: session tickets lack random ticket_age_add
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#2092793: session tickets lack random ticket_age_add

notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the golang standard library, io/fs. Calling Glob on a path that contains a large number of path separators can cause a panic issue due to stack exhaustion. This could allow an attacker to impact availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: stack exhaustion in Glob
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. Calling the Reader, Read method on an archive that contains a large number of concatenated 0-length compressed files can cause a panic issue due to stack exhaustion.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: stack exhaustion in Reader.Read
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: An uncontrolled resource consumption flaw was found in Golang math/big. A too-short encoded message can cause a panic in Float.GobDecode and Rat.GobDecode in math/big in Go, potentially allowing an attacker to create a denial of service, impacting availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: decoding big.Float and big.Rat types can panic if the encoded message is too short, potentially allowing a denial of service
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#2113814: decoding big.Float and big.Rat types can panic if the encoded message is too short, potentially allowing a denial of service

vulnerabilities.title: decoding big.Float and big.Rat types can panic if the encoded message is too short, potentially allowing a denial of service

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the golang package, where programs that compile regular expressions from untrusted sources are vulnerable to memory exhaustion or a denial of service. The parsed regexp representation is linear in the input size. Still, in some cases, the constant factor can be as high as 40,000, making a relatively small regexp consume larger amounts of memory. After the fix, each regexp being parsed is limited to a 256 MB memory footprint. Regular expressions whose representation would use more space than that are rejected. Routine use of regular expressions is unaffected.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: limit memory used by parsing regexps
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#2132872: limit memory used by parsing regexps

vulnerabilities.title: limit memory used by parsing regexps

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the net/http library of the golang package. This flaw allows an attacker to cause excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests. HTTP/2 server connections contain a cache of HTTP header keys sent by the client. While the total number of entries in this cache is capped, an attacker sending very large keys can cause the server to allocate approximately 64 MiB per open connection.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#2161274: excessive memory growth in a Go server accepting HTTP/2 requests
